author: Ian14
title: Unable to get an appointment
body:
After 2 weeks of trying to get an appointment for our 5 year old daughter we had to call 111 as myself and partner were on hold for 40min each from 8am to get an appointment today with surgery. 111 called us back and we have been advised by them to get an appointment at our surgery. After 10 minutes on phone to nurse/doctor at 111 we have had to go out of area, 15 miles away, to get our daughter seen too.  
We find this a very poor practice and are thinking of moving surgeries. None of our children or ourselves are ill, and we think the surgery has gone downhill in the last 2 years.

author: Athaz
title: Impossible to get a GP appointment
body:
I started working abroad and became ill during one of my trips (I go for 1-2 weeks at a time). I returned home and tried for more than a week to speak to my GP.  
The Covid and flu took nearly 3 weeks to clear but left me with what I thought was a nasty facial cold sore. I visited an outpatient treatment clinic and they told me it was a wart and could not help. I tried again for more than a week to get a GP appointment, eventually speaking to the receptionist who promised me a call back from one of the doctors, but nothing. I tried again and after 3 days and countless redials over many attempts I spoke to the receptionist again. She explained that the doctor had tried calling me, which I do not believe is true; I was home the whole time and had no missed calls.  
I could not get a new appointment. By this time I was looking at self-treatment by freezing it (a kit you can buy at the pharmacy). I tried it but it failed to go away or shrink. At a second attempt to treat it myself the pharmacist said it didn't look like a wart but something else. I have other long acute conditions which I get prescription drugs and wanted to speak at least to my GP to ask if they could be causing the warts. It's impossible. The NHS staff are brilliant professionals and I can't say a bad word about them but this situation is degrading people's lives. I have not returned to work as my facial disfigurement is embarrassing.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Portsmouth

author: Tomchar
title: Wait for medication review
body:
My husband has bowel cancer with secondary liver and is currently undergoing palliative chemotherapy weekly. He is also on blood pressure medication from the surgery and this is due for review. We requested this yesterday and the date that we have been given for the medication review is the 18th of May. Now in general that would not be an issue but when filling in the Econsult form it stated that he is suffering from light headedness which we know is due to the blood pressure medication. Is it correct that it should be four weeks if there is an issue with his medication, which was clearly stated on the form when completing for the review? I’m just really pulling my hair out in complete frustration because it seems to be one thing after the other.  
The fact that we’ve been patients with Thorpewood for 19 years plus and no one has bothered to contact my husband to find out how he’s getting on with his cancer treatment is neither here nor there. We should not have any preferential treatment but I would’ve thought a simple phone call for five minutes would not of been much to ask for. My husband doesn’t ask for much or for that matter complain very much but I think even he is completely astounded by the wait for the medication review.

author: filingqe87
title: Diagnosis
body:
I need to find out how I go about being misdiagnosed on a condition. I have been diagnosed with MS but every time I say I have a relapse or anything MS-related nothing gets done and it gets put down to FND. Even losing the use of my right leg suddenly I've been told will be a pseudo relapse or FND.  
My MS nurse also said about seeing a psychiatrist even though I have no mental health condition. I'd also like to know how to change my MS doctor.

readBy.name: NHS Grampian
ACVO TSI
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: rainsq67
title: Overall my stay has been great
body:
Overall my stay at the NRC has been great, I have built a good routine here.  
The healthcare assistants have been great with my care and helping me with what I require help with e.g. washing daily, shaving etc.  
The therapy staff are very good at checking in with you and making sure you're okay regularly when in the gym and ensuring you're not too tired/in pain. However, I feel that in the gym, there could be more equipment tailored to different people's needs, as everyone has different things that they need and would like to work on, specifically people who are unable to walk.  
I'm looking forward to going home now and being more independent now that I have a suitable place to live with thanks to the team here.

readBy.name: Royal Free Neurological Rehabilitation Centre
Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body: I can’t speak highly enough of my experience at Barlborough. Every member of staff I met was helpful, friendly and professional and made sure that all my questions were answered so I felt confident when going for surgery. I was home a day after a hip replacement which has been a life changing operation. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hospital.

title: Amazing
body: I had 2 appointments here within a week of each other and the 2 ladies who lead the appointments went above and beyond and the lady on the telephone appointment really took the time to listen to me. Thank you to them all.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing Doctor
body: Brilliant practice. Such caring and friendly staff. You are very well looked after and the girls do everything they can to help you. Can't recommend them enough.

title: Professional and caring
body: The paramedics who came to attend to me yesterday were amazing. Kind, caring, reassuring and very professional.

title: Wonderful staff
body: I took my daughter to A&E on The early hours of Sunday morning. All the staff were fantastic. Unfortunately, in the short time we were at the main reception, we witnessed two instances of rudeness/ verbal abuse from members of the public. These were dealt with professionally, and supportively from the security staff and head nurse, who were also careful to make sure we felt safe. The care in childrens A and E was also kind and professional, with all the staff going out of their way to put my daughter at ease. The nurses doing Observations and the doctor who checked on her were wonderful. Thank you to everyone for such kindness in difficult circumstances.

title: Dismissive practitioner
body: I went to the hospital for tests at the recommendation of two seperate GPs. The practitioner dismissed me after an initial examination and didn't do any of the additional tests I had been referred for. I appreciate their experience, but it was a pretty patronising experience that didn't actually give any additional information or peace of mind.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding
body: This is genuinely the nicest practice I have ever been a patient of. The GPs, clinical staff and reception/admin staff are so nice, proficient and professional.  The pandemic has put a huge strain on NHS resources, yet this practice has managed to persevere to keep things running as 'normal' throughout. I can be myself when I speak to a GP and I feel they genuinely care for those precious ten minutes of my appointment.  The staff really listen to what I have to say and I am treated like a human being and not just another number.  The reception staff are always friendly, professional and I've never had a problem getting an appointment. I also appreciate that this practice caters for those who work full-time and the extended opening hours are a godsend when my 'problem' doesn't necessarily mean I need time off work. You hear so many negative stories about GP surgeries and especially the receptionists. They do a fabulous and very hard job as they are they are the first person a patient encounters and I have only praise for them. A little kindness goes a long way.

title: Refused /Ignored request to join practice...
body:
Despite online and calling I was informed that due to "boundary changes"I am unable to join.  Despite the fact all others on my street use this GP? There are only around 10 houses!  Further, attempts for the surgery to clarify were ignored and even a promised phone call was ignored. 

Wow....

title: First class treatment
body: After talking to 111, I took my 99 year old mother to A/E today. We were seen straight away, had a chest X-ray, EGG, bloods and a nebulizer and discharged within four hours. As always, everyone was so kind and caring towards us both and very efficient.  Ageism is never a problem for us at RSCH, my Dad was kept alive by them to 101 and they were still trying to get him to 102 when he died. I hope we never have to go anywhere else.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lacking empathy, professional courtesy
body:
My child has had persistent cough , worsening with spiking temperature. Being a doctor , having known our doctor, I treated it as viral related infection. I waited nearly 10 days to seek medical attention and that was her first need to be seen urgently
However, having persistent cough to the extent she needed to leave school and return home. I took her to the couldn't care less A@E department 
Seen by a triage nurse who had no professional courtesy or empathy. She took my daughter's temperature which was raised as well as her heart rate. Turned to me and gave us a lecture about the workings of emergency department and I need to be seen in the urgent treatment centre. Complete lack of empathy and communication skills. No rapport.
calling the paediatric registrar who was oncall, proved to be a waste of my time as obviously she was concerned upsetting the triage nurse.
Despite finishing 15 hours night shift serving the NHS to the best of my abilities, I m spending my sleeping time waiting for my daughter to be seen. Obviously, bad management and professional skills as I will have no choice but to take the night off as carers leave to look after my own child as no one will !
Thank you for making all patients suffer

readBy.name: Barts Health NHS Trust

title: Worst experience ever
body: I went there with my mom she was feeling sick and the security guy didn’t let us in to speak with receptionist he told us to wait outside for 3 hours !!! And we returned back home really bad experience !!!!

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Efficient
body: I had an appointment for my booster jab. I was seen on time. The procedure was explained to me. It was efficient and professionally dealt with

title: Well run, supportive practice
body: We’ve had such good experiences with this practice. Well run, efficient and friendly place. They take blood tests on site and have specialists to help with allergies. Have been great with our kids and did such good work supporting us through the pandemic

title: Excellent service
body: I have always been treated fairly and kindly when visiting this practice and find their appointments system satisfactory - thank you!

title: Excellent service re Covid
body: Exemplary organisation for Covid jab clinic. In and out in no time as clinic was well staffed and well thought out

title: Ridiculous
body: Waiting time taking way to long 6 to 8 hour Waiting times not a good experience. Doctors and NHS staff should prioritise organizing more night shift staff on urgent care. And see more patients in a quicker time frame.

readBy.name: The Royal Wolverhampton NHS Trust

title: Very good with Covid vaccines
body: Efficient and well organised.  Staff directing so no problem knowing procedures.  Very well run clinic with no hold ups.

title: Very poor service
body:
I am registered in the surgery for over 5 years.
The last 2 years the service is almost non existent. Very difficult to get an appointment, twice booked appointments that did not happen. If you get a referral, they simply don’t follow up and that are not happening. It is a pity because most of the doctors seem good, the problem is mainly on administration, it is almost impossible to get access to any service.

title: Minor Injury Unit
body: I visited the MIU as i had a painful injury and swelling to my foot the chap on the booking desk was nice and friendly, But when I saw a practitioner he was very dismissive, Didn't ask to see the site of the injury just kept looking at my trainers, He sent me for an x-ray which was the only time i was ask to remove my trainer and sock. After my x-ray was done i was asked to wait in reception and noticed that at least 3 people that were triaged and x-rayed after me when being seen again by the practitioners, The chap that saw me eventfully came out and was acting as if he had forgotten about me told to wait he'll be back in a minute seemed like he went for a tea-break. he came back was very dismissive again telling that i need to wait up to 7 days for the Ibuprofen to take effect and sent me on my way. Later that night the pain was so unbearable and the over the counter meds were doing nothing. I had to call 111 Thank god as this doctor i spoke to on a live chat examined my foot something she said the first chap should have done. I haven't been able to put any weight on my foot and just feel that this gentleman bedside manner needs to be improved. How can a patient come and say where the issue is and the practitioner shows no interest in looking at the problem. I found him to be someone wasn't bothered i could understand if this was late at night but this was 1st thing in the morning

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sussex
Sussex Community NHS FoundationTrust

title: Bedfont surgery
body: Extremely unsatisfied. I  called surgery today for an emergency aytempts after 22 nd attempt i managed to speak to the receptionist . I am covid positive and i have severe palpitation    needs a review o (am also  in medical profession).   She said there is no emergency appointment today . I just enquired for a sick certificate  too .how i apply one . I never applied one before. She told me you need to apply online.  After she told me please dont call for 08 am for sick certificate . I said i never called for sick certificate . I need a review with my gp since i had  palpitation   .  When patients are so frustrated and tired  these type ofresponse make them upset. I also served NHs for 18 years  and i felt it very bad.

title: Dedicated professionals
body: I would like to thank you screening midwives team also ante-natal ultrasound team for them great practice and management. Excellent professionals dedicated and competent.

title: Appointments
body: Waiting to hear results for an mri and can’t get an appointment  surgery has received them but will not tell me until my appointment which is not until 25 may this is unacceptable as I’m in pain and wondering what’s causing it

author: bluexs84
title: Quick and efficient childrens A&E
body: My little boy was unwell, on a friday afternoon. The department was busy, but nothing was a bother. We were seen quickly and moved to the panda unit as soon as possible on arrival. We were treated by the matron of panda and a student nurse. Really settled our worries, gave us information to take away and a service with a smile. Really reassuring, thank you so much.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The ward is very clean and tidy
body:
I have been a few times with my daughter’s condition, so this is not my first time being in the daisy ward. I have to say everything is good, and admittedly the ward is very clean and tidy.  
The staff up here are grand and I think it is very good that they explain everything and ensure I understand what they are talking about.  
There is no improvements to be made, there is nothing else to be done here it is excellent.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Disappointted Ayrshire
title: We both caught COVID
body: My wife has been in hospital, firstly in Ayr on various wards. They didn’t know what was wrong with her, finally decided that she had endocarditis, massive doses of antibiotics which after 3 months are still continuing. They moved her The Golden Jubilee where she had open heart surgery. Whilst there she had a fall (she has not been good on her feet for 20 years after a viral encephalitis which left her with epilepsy) and broke her ankle and to my knowledge her leg as well . The nurse who phone me said she had had a small accident and that at least she didn’t have to go to a+e . While she was in the cardiac ward in Ayr hospital she also caught Covid and so did I. After 2 years, we both caught Covid from an NHS hospital. It honestly feels like they have tried their best to drive me insane.

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran
Golden Jubilee National Hospital
Scottish Government

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: They work together as such a great team
body:
I landed into accident and emergency with my very young son, it was good, very very quick and did not have long to wait to get transferred up to here, daisy ward.  
The staff in accident and emergency were brilliant they done all they could.  
Daisy ward is brilliant everything here is perfect and the place is so clean and tidy there is not a speck of dirt anywhere.  
The staff are really good and brilliant they work together as such a great team and they are really really good with my daughter.  
This place does not need any improvements.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: shoulderwrencher
title: I am very grateful for my prompt and efficient treatment
body:
I attended Stoke Mandeville Accident and Emergency Department in early March 2022 in the late afternoon with a dislocated left shoulder. I am in my mid seventies and I was in considerable pain.  
I was seen quickly by the Triage Nurse Tabassam.  
He sent me for ex-ray and on my return had me seen by the Consultant Mr Esa who put my shoulder joint back in place. I was sent for a second ex-ray and discharged.  
A couple of days later I was telephoned by Julie from the Physiotherapy Department. She then emailed me information on my care.  
I am writing to say how impressed I was by the care provided to me by the staff in Stoke Mandeville A&E. I think I was only in A&E for about an hour.  
It would be hard to see how my care could have been better.  
Nurse Tabassam was informal, caring and sympathetic. Mr Esa did a brilliant job in putting me back in place and I regret to say I am becoming something of an expert on the procedure (third time in two years).  
The final surprise was to receive the telephone call from Julie.  
I am very grateful for my prompt and efficient treatment at Stoke Mandeville A&E and to Nurse Tabassam, Mr Esa and Julie.

readBy.name: Buckinghamshire Healthcare NHS Trust

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

title: Refusal of medication
body: I was refused a prescription yesterday and was told to go to the chemist. I am living on benefits,which dont cover my cost of living, but do allow me free prescriptions. The text I recieved was rude. I emailed the practise manager and have heard nothing back. So.. how do I get the medication I need, when I havent the money for it?

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff in female medical are great
body:
I came in through accident and emergency it was 100% although I had to wait a while to get seen to then a while waiting on a bed to be available.  
The staff there were excellent I could not say a bad word.  
After being taken to female medical it is dead on, there is not a thing wrong with it. The food is good and I cannot complain.  
The staff in female medical are great they work together.  
The whole ward is good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been good to me
body:
I was taken in from Craigavon Area Hospital after I had a hip replacement I am here for recovery before going to a step down.  
Female medical is very clean and tidy I never see dirt in here. I am receiving adequate care and everyone has to get on as we are all in such close quarters.  
I cannot fault the staff on their care they are brilliant, they have been very very good to me.  
Although the food in here is not appetising, and the toilets are definitely not suitable for someone who has had a hip replacement I sit down and cannot get back up. In addition, the no visitors or the booking system is very difficult to organise as all my children are working at different times, it leaves me feeling depressed as I have not seen them in 2 weeks.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Accident and emergency was absolutely fantastic
body:
Accident and emergency was absolutely fantastic and I have to say the doctor there was amazing.  
I was then taken to here, female medical, and it is okay, I have asked to see a Doctor and they said they would come see me although there has not been any sign of them in over two hours, it worries me since my issue is with my heart.  
The staff however, are great and everyone is so nice especially Agnes the staff nurse.  
The only thing I would improve would be the lack of information being given to us as my heart rate was over 130 beats per minute and I was not told anything about it, and have taken me off my heart medication.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: It has been a waste of my time
body:
I have had a horrific experience in the hospital. I came into accident and emergency after getting head pain while working in Dublin I came straight here, that was nine days ago.  
Accident and emergency was a nightmare, I had to wait 11 hours to get a bed in A&E and more hours to get transferred to a bed in female medical. It was a disaster.  
While in female medical I was worse off than before I came in. I felt neglected all over the Easter break. I had a spinal tap done on good Friday and they did not tell me that I should have been lying down drinking caffeine and water for two days after, therefore I was walking about going up and down the stairs on phone calls and seeing my family outside the hospital. I was then informed the following Wednesday by the anaesthetist after everyone was back from their holidays that a procedure should have been done on my pin hole to help it heal the day after but I never got that done. Also they gave me morphine and to help with the pain, but was again informed that I should not have been getting it that I should have been getting normal pain medication. I even seen them fighting amongst themselves as they could not agree on or justify why I was given the morphine. They have ruled out that it is a head injury although have offered if I wait until Monday that they would transfer me to neurology in Craigavon, although they also told me I could go home and rest for a week. I have the same problem as I had when I came in as the only thing they have treated is the pain they caused me through the spinal tap that did not heal correctly  
The nurses are cannot be blamed they were just doing what they were told by a higher power. They were all grand.  
Overall, this visit to the hospital has caused me unnecessary pain and suffering. It has been a waste of my time and has been a terrible experience.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Excellent care
body: My care has been absolutely excellent ever since I arrived onto the ward on monday. The main reason for this is the staff they have been absolutely exceptional. They are so kind and so considerate and have taken such good care of me. Nothing is too much hassle for them and they do anything I ask of them no matter how simple or complicated. They really are amazing and without them checking in and having conversations my care would have been a lot more boring. They are also so easy to understand and will sewer any questions that I may have of them. They have been so kind and I am so appreciative of all they have done for me. The food has been very good so far and I always get plenty. Everything has also been very clean. I have had no issues and would like to thank all the members of staff that have treated me so well and have been so understanding and caring

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: HF16
title: Her advice was very reassuring and helpful
body:
I contacted out of hours mid April with concerns regarding my three year old son.  
I am aware OOH is experiencing great challenges and difficultly in service provision.  
I spoke with a lovely nurse (Nurse Taggart) who was very understanding and pleasant. Her advice was very reassuring and helpful.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: No response  from  e-consultation
body: I have done a couple of e-consultations (last one recently) and have not had any reply from clinician or admin staff.  They should have a robust system to reply to all e-consultations and  avoid patient calling the Practice  back for a reply, which defeats the purpose of e-consultations.

title: Caring practice
body:
Doctors are kind and caring 
They have great listening and diagnostic skills 
I have never felt rushed

title: Terrible Practice
body: I was left on hold for 2 hours before being disconnected - no indication on where I was in the queue. I had expected the service to improve once they had been in the papers but this has not happened. It is one of the worst GPs I have ever experienced.

title: Brill practice
body:
Went for my covid booster very well org
anised i was in and out within minutes i have been with this practice for years and i have always had exelent service

title: Great response to econsult
body: Every time I have used the econsult facility I've had a really swift positive outcome.  The reception team are always friendly

title: Very well run, safe practise
body: You always feel safe visiting the practise as evrrything seems to be very well organised, caring staff.

title: Amazing treatment
body: On 2nd March I reported at the minor injuries unit with chest pains.  I was seen without delay.  The nurse was very efficient and after a series of tests, she suggested she called an ambulance to take me to A&E at Musgrove Park Hospital in Taunton.  Whilst there I was told that the nurse had probably saved my life.  After a series of tests at Musgrove Park, I was transferred to The Bristol Heart Institute where I had a coronary artery bypass procedure.  I have subsequently made a complete recovery.

readBy.name: Somerset NHS Foundation Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Impressed with staff
body: My care so far has been satisfactory since I was transferred from the royal hospital last night. During my short stay so far I have been very impressed with the staff as they all seem to be doing a fantastic job and seem to be very passionate about the work that they are doing. The nurses have already taken fantastic care and do their job very well. The doctors were round this morning and were very polite and easy to understand which made the transfer a kit easier. The food has been okay so far and I have been offered toast and tea this morning. I am very impressed with how clean the place has been which has put any fears at ease. I have had no issues so far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Poor Customer Service/ Unprofessional
body: I have been a regular patient with the surgery, sometimes the service is good but lately its very poor and lacking many aspects. The front desk seems always chaotic and often very impolite and impatient. I have spoken to them regarding this multiple times and explained that they need to be more patience with people because we call them with a problem and want their help and advice, instead they are just automated robots not showing any understanding. I have always to call and follow up on referrals and check if they have been actually done or not and many times they were not done or cancelled by the hospital and we did not get notified. If they are expecting patients to follow up on an these things then at least inform us so we keep calling and checking. I asked if they have received my hospital report which has been more than a month ago and they simply told me to call the hospital myself and find out because they don't do that anymore. I ask them what happened with a referral for my son, she tells me the GP is on annual leave and we have to wait for him to come back, surely someone else can access the system and find out for me? But apparently this is not urgent, while I have been waiting already couple weeks for it. I tell them that I am unhappy with the service received by one of their clinicians, they tell me to look for another surgery!!!! This is absolutely disrespectful and I wouldn't know what to do with them anymore. Its not easy to change surgeries nowadays and moreover its emotionally not easy to keep speaking to different people about your health issues when you just got used to the surgery and what do they do? They just tell me to go somewhere else. This comment made me leave this feedback on here because I really want them to invest in their reception staff, educate them, train them and listen to patients comments. I believe they don't care what the reasons are for people leaving them instead of appreciating our feedback and work on the points we mention to them to improve their services.

title: Caring and supportive practice
body:
Helpful, caring and supportive to very elderly patient and carer. Reception helpful.
Text messaging great. Organisation re Covid for jabs. Excellent for distancing and access. Really good to have pharmacy next door - again wonderful service and support

title: Desperate
body: Absolutely disgraceful. Unable to get through to surgery. Constantly engaged. Tried over 100 times this morning. Bad enough feeling ill but this makes you feel desperate and at a loss at what to do. It is always the same. Prior to Covid it was dreadful and always a problem  now it is 10 times worse. Everywhere you look, the reviews regarding this surgery are terrible and all state the same. They never contact you about annual checks, you have to contact them for procedures to be carried out. If you ask for a referral online, you are never notified if it is ready for collection. The window at reception  is only open certain hours every day, with only one receptionist. A few months ago I tried to get through to the surgery for a week, to no avail. I managed to get through the following Monday.  I needed a repeat prescription which a dermatologist had prescribed. I was told as it was over a year since it had been prescribed, I had to see GP. I asked if I could make appointment but was told they were all gone but to call back tomorrow. I explained I had tried for a week to get through. I was told there was nothing they could do, but call 111 or go to A&E. Just unbelievable. No wonder these hospitals are on their knees. Absolutely disgusting.

author: tryingtobeamum
title: Ultimately we leave the service no more supported
body:
My daughter was seen by speech and language after I self referred, asking for help with the fact that there are situations in which she is unable to talk, or she talks so quietly that she cannot be heard or understood.  
Unfortunately the therapist we saw didn't seem particularly interested in helping us, repeatedly asking if there was support to access in light of my daughter being autistic. She seemed to have no understanding of autism, particularly how females with autism present which is disappointing when autism is, in part, a communication disability.  
Eventually it was decided we would be discharged as my daughter wasn't able to communicate why she can't talk in certain situations, which is ironic and feels like a lot of pressure to put on a child.  
Ultimately we leave the service no more supported than we were before and no more able to know how to help my daughter communicate in the situations she finds challenging.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley
Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)
Healthcare Improvement Scotland

links.id: like it was our problem to solve alone

title: Ridiculous wait times
body:
Over an hour on hold to get through 9 phone places..went into the surgery whilst on hold and no phones ringing everybody stood about chatting .

Tried clicking on poor experience option to leave feedback and wouldn't continue

Service here is a joke!

readBy.name: Healthwatch Surrey

title: Impossible to actually see a doctor.
body: If you are unfortunalety taken ill, do not contact the rude, uncaring staff at this practice. If you cannot wait 2 weeks for a phone call from a "health professional", you would be better going and joining the 6 hour queue at A&E. Your telephone operators are your patients first point of contact and their lack of professionalism is staggering.

title: Extremely happy with this practice
body: I can't fault East Harling Surgery, all the staff are brilliant and have supported me amazingly, especially over the last year after a serious illness. Is it difficult to get an appointment? Yes, sometimes but unfortunately this is the NHS at the moment. The staff are doing the very best they can with the problems that covid (and a lack of funding) have caused. Thank you for all your hard work

title: Very supportive
body:
I visited the practice twice this week - both for an appointment for myself and an appointment for my daughter.
At both visits (which were with two different clinicians) I felt listened to, not rushed, very supported and received some helpful advice.
The clinician who saw my daughter was very kind with her and supported me well as a parent.
When I've emailed the practice admin team this week too, they have responded very quickly and helpfully.
Really pleased and reassured with the service from the practice this week.

title: Exceptional
body: Cannot praise the staff high enough. They are friendly, efficient and, above all, caring. The only thing I would wish to see added is a phlebotomy clinic. Apart from that - world class!

title: It is a great practice
body: Message from practice was clear and precise about my COVID 19 injection. On the day they we're very good was straight in and out, also we're good with advise.

title: Great practice
body: All the staff where so friendly and polite , The building was  utterly perfect, The only down side was the seats were a bit hard. The next day my left eye was like new I was amazed that I could see to read and drive my car after many years , Thank you so very much, Looking forward to haveing my right eye done . In May 21 st .

title: wonderful pratice
body: I have been with St Saviours Surgery 40 years. I always had really good experiencies with all my needs.  Staff always helpful from G Ps downwards. the best surgery i have ever been involved with. i also would like to thank the staff who gave their Sunday up to give the booster vacine to us yesterday the 24th of April. Thank you everyone.

title: Great staff
body: Had a recent colonoscopy at Stepping Hill. To be honest I was really worried having never had one before. The staff on the day were so nice and put me at ease on arrival. A special mention to the lady who did the procedure and the 2 nurses who assisted, a credit to both the hospital and the NHS. Thanks again.

readBy.name: Stockport NHS Foundation Trust

title: Indifferent GP
body:
Fortunately I have had a very healthy life and had no need to avail myself of hospitals and GPs, until very recently, having had a recent issue that required going to the local hospital A&E dept, I was strongly advised to see my GP with regard to the problem,  several times, after much chasing I was eventually given an appointment with the GP, the response was that the GP had no knowledge of the problem and therefore could not give any advise, further that the reports from the hospital about my problem are not read by the GP due to a lack of time, so who does read them and decide what action if any should be taken, eventually the GP decided that there was no further discussion required.
I am now in the process of arranging an appointment with a private hospital for the tests I was told I must have, this is going to cost me a lot of money,  I feel that I have no other choice for the protection of my health, the GP receptionists are always polite.
Maybe I am being a little old fashioned but it does seem that there is none or little care from my experience of this GP practice, from my experience I couldn’t recommend this practice

title: Frustrating practice
body: Telephone service is unbelievably BAD. They have acknowledged that there is a fault and are dealing with it. They must take us for idiots as this problem has been going on for years, yes years. I understand that the lines are busy but to be cut off after waiting 35 minutes is too much to accept. Then to be repeatedly told ‘That is not a valid response’ over and over again needs seriously sorting out.

title: Poor appointment organsiation! Misleading Text…
body: On Saturday 23rd April I recieved a text message from the hospital stating I have a' APPOINTMENT' on the  25/04/22 at 9am in Cardiology! Firstly, this was sent out on a weekend ( extremely last minute) so had no way of checking anything before arrival. I arrive (today) Monday morning in cardiology, to find out this text was regarding a 'reminder to return heart monitor' which I had ALREADY returned a week prior to this! Also nowhere in the text did it state that it was 'only a reminder'! I was turned away without any appointment. Extremley misleading and a huge waste of my time ! Very disapointed in this lack of organisation and communication. I wasted money and time travelling to the hospital. What's even more concerning is the receptionist mentioned I'm not the only patient who has arrived for an appointment due to a misleading text message! How many people have had to organise  travel arrangements, possibly childcare ,book time off work etc... for an appointment that doesn't exist! This is out of order and needs to be sorted!

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Greeting by security at entrance of a and e
body: The greet we received at entrance of a and e was awful. The greeting we got from the men was so harsh and cold!!! Entering with our small child and being told we wasn't allowed in with her and these 2 men have/had no idea on why we was entering a and e with her. It may have been life threatening or anything and the way we was treated is disgusting!!!I drove to another hospital!!! Never go here!!!!

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: nothing to worry about!
body: having waited 9 months for my cataract removal I had managed to  talk myself into full blown panic mode. I could not have been more wrong! The whole experience was excellent from start to finish and II now look forward  to having the other eye done. Thank you very much to all concerned

title: Rude and Aggressive staff
body:
We visited a and e last night. The nursing staff were confrontational with not only me but the majority of the waiting room. They initiated the arguments , by that I mean they weren’t responding to questions from patients , they came and spoke to people in a totally unprofessional manner that lead to conflict.  Twice I had to ask a nurse why she was using this tone with me, she just sighed rolled her eyes and continued. As I said this treatment wasn’t only for me, it seemed that it was standard behaviour for nurses here. 

As an aside the hospital could do with an overall clean it’s very dirty.

title: Complement regarding covid vaccination
body: Extremely efficient as usual. Everyone had a role which they carried out effectively. Very impressed.

title: Impossible to get appointments i
body:
Although individual medical staff- doctors and nurses have been brilliant, the service is let down by the terrible reception staff and poor processes.
I’ve been trying to get an appointment for my baby who has a cough lasting over a month after multiple calls where I’ve been on hold for half an hour I was offered a telephone call the next day in the morning (no time)- took the morning off work and of course the call came in the afternoon and I missed it. A friend who is a GP told me most practices would always see a sick baby in person as a priority, never by telephone call.
I’ve relied on A&E when I can’t get walk in appointments for injuries/infections and seen many other parents doing the same (some for things like that eczema)
During my pregnancy I was told appointments where I knew they needed to take blood pressure and urine samples would be by telephone and then called up by the doctor later in the day to ask why I hadn’t come into the surgery for it.
For my baby’s vaccinations I was told by the staff at the desk that they couldn’t book follow up appointments, I had to call up when I got home. When I did I was told I should have booked them at the desk at the last vaccination.
The staff are obviously short of time and very poorly trained, previously it was frustrating but now I have a baby it’s frightening. I’ll be changing my practice.

title: Awesome Clinicians
body: Ok let’s be honest here the medical staff are amazing very supportive and helpful and really understanding however some of the telephone staff on reception are just not on the same page. They read from the script and do little to ease your anxiety or frustration “There are no appointments” and after ten minutes talking they find you one for the very next day. Surgery does need a bit of a make over but the health care provided is super

title: Excellent service
body: Thorough and efficient health check. Staff were friendly and my appointment was on time. Would recommend this practice.

title: Maternity care
body:
On behalf of my wife and I, we would like to express our sincerest gratitude to the whole team at Kingston Hospital that assisted in the safe arrival of our baby into the world.  

From the first interaction with the antenatal team for the 12-week scan to the visiting midwives we couldn’t have asked for better attention, care, and empathy from every single member of the team over the last 9 months. 

When we consider the sheer number of doctors, nurses, midwives, porters, consultants that have supported us on the journey, we were astonished at the consistency of care.  In particular, we would like to extend our thanks to the doctors and nurses that conducted my wife’s C-section and the transitional care/recovery room teams that couldn’t have done more to both anticipate and respond to my wife and baby's every need.   

What we experienced from the staff at Kingston Hospital serves as a reminder of just why the nation cherishes the NHS and its million-plus dedicated and talented professionals. 

We will be donating to the NHS Charities Together as a small token of our appreciation.

author: Matdw53
title: The ward is understaffed
body: My care so far has been very unenjoyable and there have been times I have hated it. The ward is incredibly understaffed which makes the wait for simple things such as a drink a terribly long wait. It is fine when waiting on things such as a drink but as I need assistance for the toilet there are times I have waited over half an hour for the toilet which can sometimes lead to some very close calls. The nurses are amazing but there is so little of them that their job is incredibly difficult as they have so many tasks and patients to look after at one time that they are lays working so hard. The doctors are okay and are easily understood. The food so far has been terrible and I rarely finish the food. This means that I have to substitute the meals with snacks which feels unhealthy as I am not used to. I just really do not enjoy the food we get. Everything is nice and clean which is good and I have no other issues apart from the waits for basic necessities such as the toilet or food

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care in hospital has been excellent
body: My care in the hospital really has been excellent and I have felt amazingly looked after since my arrival into the hospital. The nurses are so friendly and are always willing to have a quick conversation despite the list of tasks they most likely have to do. They are all so friendly which makes me feel welcome in the hospital. The doctors are just the same always so nice and respectful. They also have made all my tests and results so easy to understand answering any questions that I may have. The food has been alright however it is concerning that the menu doesn’t change meaning if you were in for a period more than 3 weeks. The food is god however the menu could become boring. The cleaning that the hospital has is truly exceptional and they genially never stop cleaning the place which is a credit to the hospitals high standards of care that they give us patients

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Medication causing memory loss
body: My care has been a mystery to me so far as the medication I am on has caused me some serious complications with my memory which has been very difficult for me to come to terms with as I usually have a very good memory. I was admitted as I have dropped a considerable amount of weight in a very short period of time which worried the doctors and after tests they prescribed me medication which has caused me some serious issues with my memory. My memory has been a lot better today but last night when it was administered I was very forgetful. The nurses so far have been incredible and are always in to check on me and my bay mates which makes me feel very comfortable and secure in the hospital. I have no complaints about them as they all do their job exceptionally. I have not seen the doctors much however I do understand them when they come round I have just forgotten what they told me due to the medication. I only arrived onto the ward the yesterday and despite getting the menu I was not on the lists so I had to have leftovers which was a curry which I rarely eat and chips on the other meal which is a food I regularly avoid. This means yesterday I didn’t eat much which when the reason I was admitted was rapid weight loss it wasn’t the best start. The rooms are veer clean and in fact the whole ward even the bathrooms are regularly cleaned. I Have had no other issues apart from my memory since I arrived onto the wards

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: mikers35
title: Answering telephones
body: For nearly 40 minutes trying to get through to see a consultant that I need to see due to medical conditions I ended up hanging up and having to go into clinic to get a response from them, even though they are advising patients not to attend due to covid-19.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Just the amount of attention that I need
body: My care has been the Best I have ever been given and the nurses give me just the amount of attention that I need. They are very attentive and give me so much care and anything that I ask for or need. The food has been very good and I always get more than enough which makes it a lot easier around meal time as I never go hungry or anything like that. Everything is very well cleaned with every part of the hospital very well looked after. I have had no issues and I honestly do not see how anyone could complain about the care they have received in the hospital after my experienced.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Exceptional quality of nursing
body: My Care in the hospital has been very good with this mostly down to the exceptional quality of nursing that I have received. They are so attentive and the care that I receive has been truly exceptional. The doctors also deliver some absolutely quality care and have been exceptional in helping me understand the treatment as well as the future after surgery and discharge. My surgery went very well and the doctors were very happy with the results. The recovery ward was very calming and was very nice to be in as they got me food and made the recovery from surgery an enjoyable experience. The food has not been bad so far however more variety is needed as the menu only changes once a week and even then it is very small changes. The food however is of a good quality and is always a good temperature. Everything has been exceptionally cleaned and is everything when someone leaves. They are in the bay at least once a day and don’t miss a spot. I have had no issues and am very grateful for my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: FrancesGardner
title: Covid vaccination clinic, Stirling FK8 2AU
body: Our two children had their Covid vaccines in April in Stirling. We just wanted to thank all the staff involved in running the vaccination clinics. The service was extremely efficient and the staff did their upmost to make our slightly apprehensive children feel at ease. We especially liked the distraction techniques used and our children were delighted with their bravery certificates. Well done everyone.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

author: Patient1982!
title: I wish to pass on my sincere thanks
body:
I have received ongoing physio treatment as an outpatient through the rehabilitation process after rupturing my left achilles tendon.  
The physio Ryan made contact with myself a couple of days after surgery. At the time I felt very irritated and annoyed with my current injury- as I am generally a very active person. Having had a phone consultation firstly with Mark - he provided a small glimpse of light at the end of the tunnel. He said that if I put the work in I will get back to fitness quicker.  
After I was out of the cast I met with mark for face to face treatment- as I was now in a removable walking support boot. Ryan had given me a tailor made programme that was innovative compared to any others I had seen online, however advised caution at this early stage.  
Through a number of treatments I was showing slow and steady progress - at each session he was feeding off my enthusiasm I feel, which was of great benefit to myself. I am very self critical, however he was quick to removed any doubts I had about my own progress. I know am 5 months down the line and I’m not fully recovered but thanks to Ryan's assistance I am definitely past the uphill struggle in the early days of the injury.  
The NHS doesn’t get enough credit these days, and in the UK I feel is taken for granted. However I wish to pass on my sincere thanks to MSK at Crosshouse hospital for providing a first class service and in particular to Ryan at the physio department for doing such a great job.  
Thanks again!

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran

author: BillyF62
title: Radiotherapy
body:
I have just finished my course of radiotherapy for prostrate cancer yesterday at the Lanarkshire Beatson .  
I would just like to thank all the nurses and staff for their professionalism and caring way they treated me.  
Thank you!  
I wish all my treatment had went this way.  
in January, I received a phone call from the Beatson West of Scotland to inform me I had missed an appointment that day and my cancer treatment was being put back for 4 weeks.  
This was a shock to me as I had never received any notification regarding this appointment and when I tried to explain to the caller that if I had received the appointment, I definitely would have remembered the date.  
The caller wasn’t interested and I felt very upset and stressed. We have followed all the Covid rules and even as it was allowed, I had cancelled birthday celebrations with family and friends before I received this phone call, to keep me free from any risk of catching Covid.  
We get text messages from Other hospitals, doctors, dentists and even for our dogs vet reminding us of upcoming appointments. I think it would be beneficial for your appointments to send out reminders so this sort of incident doesn’t happen to anyone else.

readBy.name: Scottish Government
NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

author: Popbn74
title: Everyone was kind at my flexi endoscopy
body:
Procedure was painless and the whole thing went well. Everyone was so kind and I could not fault anything.  
Thankyou Gina.

readBy.name: Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Bowlerman
title: Great care when having my knee replaced
body:
I had a knee replacement 9 weeks ago and want to say a big thank you to all the staff involved in my care.  
The orthopaedic surgeon, the ward 10 nurses and auxiliaries, the team in x-ray, the physiotherapist and the porters, every one of you are a credit to the NHS.  
Despite the pressures on the health service everyone was professional and I received a great service. Thank you all.

readBy.name: NHS Fife
Fife Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everyone is very thoughtful
body: The communication with the doctors and nurses has been very good, I feel as if I am being regularly updated on all the care I have been receiving. The treatment from staff is also good, everyone is very thoughtful. The food on the ward hasn’t been great if I’m honest, I don think there is much choice and I am very picky so this isn’t great. I’ve mainly just been eating the breakfast and supper that's made on the ward by the staff.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
title: Amazing staff
body: I’ve just received some surgery and am currently recovering. The surgery went great I’m very happy and feel better already. Thanks to everyone down in the theatres who was involved, use are all amazing. The staff up on 4 north have all been taking the best care of me whilst helping me to recover as quickly as possible. I’ve been able to relax on the ward, the beds are very comfortable and glad the ward isn’t too noisy at the moment. I’ve been really enjoying the toast the support staff make for me in the mornings, it lovely.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Laura30
title: Wonderful birth experience and supportive midwives
body:
I had a wonderful birth experience in Russell Hall Maternity Unit. It's a new hospital for me to give birth in.  
I truly want to thank midwives Lucy and Natalie for being there and supporting me throughout the birth from the start. I'm so grateful.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

author: Hurt
title: Amazing support from rapid response team
body:
I was found not only to have a bad back but to have cancer.  
Within 36 hours I had phone calls and 3 visits from the carers to see how they could help me and assist me. They have hearts of gold and I cannot praise them all enough.  
I have been given walking sticks, 2 chairs and cushions, a toilet seat, a perching set and waiting for my bed supports.  
Bless each and every one of you.

readBy.name: Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Frank55
title: Professional and laid back team
body:
I cannot say enough about the team ,Dean, Vish, Debbie, Alison I normally would have felt a little embarrassed at being circumcised but this team were so professional they were chatting to me through out the surgery process , I cannot praise these people enough I had no time to think about feeling embarrassed such a professional but laid back team of nice people which alleviated any doubts whatsoever, my thank you to all great job guys.  
Exemplary come's to mind

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

author: KateMc
title: Fantasic service at cardiac assessment
body: My dad aged 83 referred by GP to CAU on Wednesday. Fast referral and was taken immediately. Bloods and heart monitoring started within minutes. Irregular heart rate diagnosed. Medication given. Monitored for a few hours. Prescription provided and collected as hospital pharmacy before discharge. Got a call yesterday to explain blood results. Brought back today for review and further monitoring after 2 days of meds. Saw cardiologist twice in 3hour period. Complete reassurance after a very thorough assessment by cardiologist and all tests completed. Treated in the most professional manner. Treated with dignity and respect. Cups of tea and toast offered regularly within 4hour stay. Fantastic service in Omagh. NHS is amazing.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency

title: Poor service
body: I rang the surgery at 8.30am and was placed as 12th in the queue. At 9am, I was placed at 9th in the queue . Then I went over in person to the surgery with the phone still connected , got to the counter and two receptionists sitting there without the phone being answered - complete ignore of their duties. I said to one of them “shall I switch my phone off “ and she replied your here now so yes switch off - their seniors need to monitor the level of calls received versus time taken to answer ! Staff need to be given training !

title: Fast appointment and lovely clinician
body:
Really impressed, completed an eConsult at 3.30pm and within the hour someone called and my son was seen at our chosen location of Strood.

Really thorough consultation, checked everything, full assessment and great advice at the end of the appointment.

Really impressed with the level of access, the speed of the appointment and my son was completely put at ease by the clinician. I felt really assured and like we were in safe hands.

author: leoparddq36
title: Autism assessment
body:
I was there with my 7 year old son and saw, what I found to be, a very unhelpful doctor who kept saying that all the things I was saying indicated autism, but as they are masking in school they couldn't do anything.  
I offered to show all the videos I got, but was told they weren't interested and nothing could be done before the school reported a problem.  
School is saying they can't report problems as the case is open already and not a new referral, so my son is left in limbo with no help from either side. Wish I could afford to go private to avoid this place altogether.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible receptionist
body:
Trying to book an appointment at this surgery is bad enough but even worse when you get one of the terrible receptionists. Rude , unhelpful , not confidential at all and left me feeling lower than I already did. This is the second time I have experienced this at the surgery since January and as I’m suffering with depression and anxiety and wanting to speak to my GP as a follow up review this service was crippling for me.
There are nice receptionists here too but it’s pot luck if you get one on the phone or at the desk.
The GPs are lovely just a real shame anyone has to endure the terrible receptionists.

title: The worst practice I ever seen
body: Never picked up the phone at 8 am and when they do it at 8.30 they don't have appointments anymore. They received new patients but they don't book 1st appointments. I need it sick leave and they don't have appointments ...last week they had the surgery closed and no one was on call to phone the patients or to tell them what to do...

title: excellent service
body:
ALL members of staff were most  kind and helpful, nothing was too much for them to do, advised at all checks what will happen next.
possible suggestion is a tv to watch whilst waiting for drops to take effect. 
overall an excellent service, highly  recommended

title: Excellent service
body: I have been anxious prior to having two of my wisdom teeth out. The surgery took less than 15 minutes, the surgeon and nurse were incredible

title: Cataract operation
body: I would like to thank very much all those involved in my second cataract operation. Both operations have gone like clockwork and I could not have had better treatment anywhere.

title: Great Service
body:
Phoned the doctors this morning and got a call back a few hours later. 
 Doctor was professional, helpful and understanding. He explained everything to me and explained the medications to me.

title: Excellent organisation
body:
I went to the surgery for my fourth COVID booster, the organisation in the surgery was excellent.  Completely straightforward, in at
one door, directed to the correct room and out through another door.

title: phone always engaged
body: got told to ring at 12:00 been trying now for 30 mins and still no one has answered just get the engaged sound this is very unprofessional on the surgery's part.

title: Telephone non-answering
body: I have phoned at my expense and waited over 25 minutes to check my appointment for tomorrow.  Nobody answers the phone, so I have given up!!!
